Please include a summary of the changes and which issue is fixed. Include relevant motivation and context.

## Type of Change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test addition/update
- [ ] Build/CI/CD update
- [ ] Other (please describe):

## Screenshots (if applicable)

## Checklist

Before submitting your PR, please review and check all of the following:

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have removed any console.log statements and debugging code

### Testing
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested this on multiple browsers (if UI changes)
- [ ] I have tested mobile responsiveness (if applicable)

### Documentation
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have updated the README (if necessary)
- [ ] I have added JSDoc comments for new functions/components
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md (if applicable)

### Dependencies
- [ ] I have checked that new dependencies are necessary
- [ ] I have verified all dependencies are secure and maintained
- [ ] I have updated package.json and lockfile appropriately

### Security
- [ ] I have considered security implications of my changes
- [ ] I have not introduced any security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I have not exposed any sensitive information (API keys, secrets, etc.)

### Breaking Changes
- [ ] This PR does not contain breaking changes
- [ ] OR: I have documented all breaking changes and migration steps

## Additional Notes

Add any additional notes, concerns, or questions for reviewers here.

- Depends on #
- Blocks #
